intro: Dictamnus albus var. caucasicus, commonly known as Caucasian white dictamnus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It features aromatic, glandular leaves that emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrant foliage and delicate floral display.
